news_header: A fuel tanker explosion in Nigeria resulted in at least 94 deaths and 50 injuries.
news_text: On Wednesday, Nigerian police confirmed that a fuel tanker explosion in Jigawa state killed at least 94 people and injured 50 others. The incident occurred late Tuesday when many victims approached the crashed tanker to collect spilled fuel. Such tragedies are common in Nigeria due to high fuel prices and inadequate transport infrastructure. The accident happened around 11:30 pm local time when the driver lost control, leading to an explosion and fire. Local officials have organized a mass burial for the victims, and the community is mourning the loss.
